en.title: Mighty Chin-Chin What's the Matter
en.drag_instruction_classify: Drag and drop the object into the matching group.
en.drag_instruction_play: Drag and drop the object to the highlighted area.
en.palette_switch_instruction: Click on the group tab to switch to another group.
en.play_instruction: Press this button to let the mighty Chin-Chin move.
en.stop_instruction: Press this button to go back to placing objects.
en.clear_objects_confirm: Do you want to remove all the objects placed in the world?
en.level01_intro_1: To help the mighty Chin-Chin, we need to learn how to use objects with special properties.
en.level01_intro_2: Each object has properties that fit different jobs.
en.level01_property_2: Each property tells us its quality and attribute.
en.level01_property_3: For example, a rubber duck is: lightweight, not very strong, floats on water, and can block electricity.
en.level01_classify_1: Classify means putting objects into groups with shared properties.
en.level01_classify_2: This allows us to use the right object for every job!
en.level01_shape_size_1: Objects can be different shapes and sizes.
en.level01_shape_size_2: For example, a soft material like clay can be squeezed to become tall, or wide.
en.level01_begin_1: Let's go ahead and shape clay!
en.level01_begin_2: Place the clay into two groups: tall and wide.
en.level01_play_begin_2: Let's help the mighty Chin-Chin cross the deadly pit!
en.level02_intro_1: Now we will look at the weight property of objects.
en.level02_intro_2: An object's weight tells us how light or heavy it is.
en.level02_intro_3: You can determine an object's weight with a balance scale.
en.level02_light_1: Here, a 2-pound pillow is light compared to a 20-pound block.
en.level02_heavy_1: A 40-pound iron block is heavy compared to a 20-pound block.
en.level02_begin_1: Now, let's sort objects into two classifications: light and heavy!
en.level02_begin_2: An object is light if the left scale goes up, and heavy if the left scale goes down.
en.level03_buoyancy_1: An object's buoyancy determines whether it floats or sinks in water.
en.level03_buoyancy_2: If an object has a lot of buoyancy, it will move up and float above water.
en.level03_buoyancy_3: If an object has no buoyancy, it will move down and sink under water.
en.level03_begin_1: Sort the objects on whether they float or sink!
en.level04_intro_1: The final mission! We will learn about the conductive property.
en.level04_intro_2: An object's conductivity determines if it can transmit heat, electricity, or sound.
en.level04_conductive_1: The iron block is highly conductive with electricity. It lets electricity flow through it very easily.
en.level04_non_conductive_1: The granite rock, on the other hand, is not conductive. The electricity is unable to flow through at all.
en.level04_begin_1: Now, let's go ahead and sort these objects on whether they are electrically conductive or not!
en.level04_begin_2: Sort these objects by electrically conductive or not!
